Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: steve w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two one week periods in July 2011. Not sure what the previous reviewer was referring to because there was no construction or noise, well the ocean waves breaking was a pleasant one. Great view from the room and my best part was eating breakfast on the balcony watching the world wake up on the beach below, priceless. Room was clean, it looked like it had recently been renovated and a great job had been done. One point though, this is not a hotel. They are all privately owned units and so there are no staff to assist. Dealt with the owner direct. Very pleasant and simple process. We had contact details for a local management company if we needed them but we didn't. For the price we paid, this was value for money and that view will be with me for a long time. Our first week was a break before driving further north and decided to stay again on the way back as we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy A
Reviews.Content: Can't remember the room #, but it was on the 4th floor. The outside was pretty grubby looking. The inside needed painting bad & had not been cleaned very well...very dirty along the baseboard/floor area. The cookware was missing handles, the can opener was rusted, one of the burners on the stove didn't work, the drip pans under the burners were not cleaned properly. We ended up buying paper plates & utensils b/c everything about the room felt dirty. The entire time we were there, they were doing construction in the rooms & pool area. Owner failed to tell us we'd be waking up to the sound of a jack hammer every morning. There was never anyone on staff at the front desk...actually I don't think they even have a staff at all, other than the owner, who serves as a maintenance guy. Don't waste your money on this place! It looked like a run-down motel that was on it's last leg!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay and a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: thetrouper
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo from a private owner and the website pictures assured us that the condo was well furnished. The reviews of the property gave us second thoughts, but we spend most of our vacation on the beach and out on the town and decided to make a reservation. Parking is convenient as you can take the elevator from the parking garage to your condo. The elevator is old and slow, but there are only 7 floors. Our condo was clean and well appointed with everything we needed during our stay. The AC was cold, no water pressure/ temperature problems, and it was quiet at night so we slept well. The pool was sparkling clean and the pool deck had plenty of chairs. Great location to walk to shops, restaurants, and bars if you desire to do so. For a couple wanting a basic, no frills oceanfront condo with a balcony and pool, we were quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with a great price!”
Reviews.Author: pddally7428
Reviews.Content: I read reviews and was apprehensive but went anyhow.Arrived and got a free upgrade to an oceanfront room. We stayed in room 303 and it was in excellent condition. they had all items there that we could need(pots,pans,dishes),even surfing boards and fishing poles.Room was very clean and offered a beautiful view of the ocean. Staff was very helpful,stayed two extra days and they kept us in the same room. Older building with slow elevators but they worked fine. Pool and deck were kept immaculate! All for 46.00 a night!! No bugs of any sort.Nice restaurant on the premises for morning and lunch meals.

Reviews.Title: “Whats all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: BmanDug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Biketober Fest and the room was a pleasant surprise. I had read the reviews here and still took a chance. The rooms were nice and clean, The beds were comfortable and the kitchen was well stocked for what we needed. The view was the best part about it! The other reviews said that it smelled there, I didn't come across any fowl smell...the service was friendly. I know all the rooms are owned by private party's but the room we had was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay from one night to a week!”
Reviews.Author: jdbiker
Reviews.Content: Biketoberfest "09. What a nice place to stay. Staff was very friendly. Had a problem with our reservation which was booked through Hotels.com. The assistant manager found and corrected the mistake in minutes, and offered us an upgrade, no extra charge. We will try to go back next year. Clean room. Always fresh towels each day. Great view of the ocean. Easy access to the beach from the pool. Covered parking for both van and bike. Nice to have a restaurant on site. Good breakfast each morning. Talked to others who come back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “on the ocean”
Reviews.Author: myfamilyof9
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Daytona on a spur of a moment trip with my teenage daughter and her friend. We did not have a reservation but it was the nly hotel with rooms being that it was Spring Break and I didn't know that. Checked in during a time when alot of construction was going on adn still thought the price was too high but we were 24 hours away from home and needed someplace to stay. It was an old room that needed alot of updates but I would return again just because we didn't spend a lot of time in the room so what we used for worked for us. I am looking to book 5 rooms and bring my family there and enjoy the 2nd night free special...

Reviews.Title: “For the price, you can't really beat it!”
Reviews.Author: JBellDesign
Reviews.Content: Ok first let me just say, I'm what some of my friends call "high maintenance," so when my girlfriends and I drove up to this place, we almost turned around and got a room at the Hilton right down the street. We were a bit scared. The outside of the building was not very attractive, but we decided to give it a go anyway. We get into the elevators and couldn't stop laughing because it seemed to be getting worse. The hallways were a bit dingy too. Then we got into our oceanfront room, and we were like, OK we can do this. By the time the weekend was over, we didn't want to leave! Let me explain why...first just so you know, all the units are privately owned "condos" so some are managed by the owners (that is who we dealt with, NOT the front desk) and some are managed by the management staff (if that makes sense). But either way, some units are taken care of more than others because of the owners. Also, it is on the beach, in Florida. Humidity + Salt = not so perfect carpet, furniture, paint, etc. I experience the same thing in Hawaii. I'm sure if you picked a part the rooms in some of the other hotels you would see some rust, etc. Another thing, and this was something I had to get over myself, you go to the beach to enjoy the BEACH, NOT YOUR ROOM! I know, I know, you want it to be nice, I get that, but in all honesty, we were in our room to sleep and snack and refresh our drinks. The beds weren't bad, it slept 4 just fine. The balcony and view was absolutely amazing. It's like the sunrise is dead center right in front of you. It was perfect. The pool is a decent size, and because it's a smaller hotel, it's not so packed. Everyone was friendly too. Probably because there are more down to earth kind of people staying there. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE my Resort/Spa hotels and there is no comparison to the quality, but for a total cost $140.62 for all day Friday, Saturday and Sunday, you just can not beat the price. You can't get a room per night at that rate at the Hilton next door, and I can't wrap my head around spending triple or quadruple that price just for a better room. Not when I'm there for the BEACH. If I was going for a longer stay somewhere, where I did plan on spending some time relaxing in the room, no, this would not be the place to go because the rooms just aren't that fabulous. But again, who freakin' cares when you're at the beach? You're on vacation. You just have to make the best of it, especially in these times when money is tighter, I don't care who you are. The place is in a great location, you can walk to a lot of the restaurants and shops, the pool is clean and a decent size, and it doesn't matter if your staying in a 5 star hotel or not, doesn't change the experience of a gorgeous Florida sunrise. So if you want to get away for a short weekend with the girls, or your honey, this really isn't a bad place to go. Just get passed the front entrance, and the elevators and into your room and check out the beautiful view of the ocean, and you'll forget your not in a glamorous resort and spa! PS. Get an oceanfront room! It's what makes the hotel worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I was shocked at how rude the staff was.”
Reviews.Author: fuse01
Reviews.Content: I looked at several rooms on our return trip. When I told the front desk staff that I wasn't happy they were very rude. Don't use your credit card at this hotel! They will put a hold on it even if you don't stay.

Reviews.Title: “Surprized!”
Reviews.Author: dstar4cup
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute. We didn't think we were going to go watch the college cheer nationals but at the last minute we were able to. Most of the hotels were already booked. I had read the reviews and was scared but went ahead and book here. I seen on their website that if you called them direct that they would give a 30% discount. I called them and book a cityview room for 4 nights and my cost with tax was around $220.00. When we arrived at our room we had been given a oceanview room. Nice surprise. One thing that i worry about with older hotels is gross carpet. The floors in our room were tile so no need to worry about ugly gross carpet. The people at the front desk were very pleasant. We had some of our daughter's friends come see us at the room and they had forgotten their purses in the room. The front desk called and confirmed that the girls were needing in the room to get their stuff. I thought that was very nice of them. Saved us a trip back to the hotel from the competition.

Reviews.Title: “SCAMORAMA - don't buy in to this!”
Reviews.Author: MissesTravelista
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend accompanied me to Daytona Beach for a work trip around the Daytona 500 race weekend. I received a call from an "owner" of one of these condos who got my name from some unknown person ( I'm assuming from a waiting list at other hotels) who, "promised me a great rate of $140 a night, in one of the updated, and super clean rooms". Because I was staying on my works tab, and had booked a hotel farely farther from the track with a bigger price than this place, I took the bait, to try and save money and travel time. When we arrived this man took a picture of me, got his check, and quickly left. After he left we started loooking around and noticed open cans of paint, cleaning supplies, boxes of leftover tiling, etc. ALL of this is right smack in the place where the, "closet" (if you want to call it that) was. So where are you to put your clothes? Then when trying to open the blinds they fell straight to the ground, the backdoor wouldn't close or open right and the room is SO LOUD at night because of the single pain glass and the noisy neighbors you can't rest at all! I spent the first night crying my eyes out, worried if we were safe, and that this was some kind of cruel joke. I called every hotel in the area to try to find another room with no luck. I would never think about even thinking about staying here ever again. Ladies, this is no joke, you will be miserable. If you're a single bachelor or something be my guest.

Reviews.Title: “Old but Adequate”
Reviews.Author: G0Herd
Reviews.Content: I reserved this room through Expedia. We stayed in room 414 over Memorial Day Weekend. The hotel is old and doesn't look like too many updates have been made. For the price however I can't complain. The upside, everyone was very friendly and helpful. The beds were clean, and everything worked for the most part. The downside, the toilet didn't flush right. It overflowed three times and had to be continually plunged. The shower was good but had some spray to the side. The carpet desperatly needed replace. If you are going to the beach to sit in the room and judge the decor, this isn't for you. If you are like us and just need a place to shower and sleep, for the price, this is ok.

Reviews.Title: “was not fantastic, but clean and O.K.”
Reviews.Author: jetteman
Reviews.Content: We rented privately, directly with an owner of a unit, not the hotel. Our accomodations were very adequate and clean, being oceanfront and overlooking the pool. The hotel is older, but the location was great (4 blocks from pier) and the price we paid was very good for race week, as other places we checked on were double in price. Advice to anyone interested in this location, deal with an owner directly, so they can send you pics of what you will be staying in. Websites such as vrbo.com are a great place to look.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend this location”
Reviews.Author: bettyboots1966
Reviews.Content: Booked online in May 2007, stayed in February 2008 for Daytona 500 race. WHAT a disappointment upon arrival, horribly depressing experience. Took over 1/2 hour to check in, clerk NOT able to multitask. Ceiling tiles in lobby were missing, stained and looked like they would fall out. Elevator is old, stinks, and feels unsafe. Hallway carpets were stained and filthy. Room door was beat up and is need of repair. Cold shower first day, tub never drained. Rooms smelled, were "cleaned" daily but dirt was was just shifted around. Bathroom was never cleaned correctly, sheets were never changed. Felt like we should not leave any valuables in the room. Was lead to believe this was a hotel when in fact it is an association with individual room owners. Security was on the premises - which didn't make us feel any more comfortable, in fact more nervous. Smoke detectors did not work, sprinkler heads were painted. Thank goodness we didn't need to spend much time in our rooms or at the "hotel". Our stay was considered miserable - Daytona 500 was awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “HORRID!”
Reviews.Author: ahawtho403
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel at all. Supposely, hotel has been under construction for some time, although we did not hear or see any effort being made. The place is very dirty. Old is okay, dirty is not. Balconey door was broke, although they did get it open the second day. Balconey window painted shut both inside and out. Kitchnette was covered in sticky residue from previous visitors, including floor, and cabinet handles. Dinette table had old, dried up food stuck to it. Tub had dirt and grime from previous visitors, and remains of an old tub mat stuck to it. Maid never did any cleaning during our week's stay. Maid replaced towels (even the clean ones smelled), emptied the waste basket, and threw the covers back over the bed. She didn't even show up the last full day we were there. We had no clean towels for showers the morning we checked out. The cover on the bed was dirty, old, and smelled. Everything smelled. You can find better quality of bed lines in a thrift store. Pool was open, but pool deck had not been cleaned in some time. Covered with seagull droppings. Vent in ceiling of bath, but no vent fan, just covered a hole in the ceiling. Masking tape around toilet shutoff valve, covering a hole in the wall. Carpet had not been vaccumed, nor was it while we were there. After complaining about the balconey door, and requesting clean towels, hotel staff displayed an attitude. This could be a reasonable place for the money, but they need to learn the definition of CLEANING, and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “stay home”
Reviews.Author: jbobber
Reviews.Content: WE wanted to go away for a couple of days ....WELL we should have stayed home, very dissapointing. Rooms were very nasty and dirty. Major construction and the noise was terrible. This hotel should be closed while the repairs are being done. 8 couples besides ourselves checked out imm....... Save your money stay home or book another hotel. Hotels.com states this was mentioned on there site it was NOT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl00
Reviews.Content: Horrible is the only way to decribe this hotel. There is major work being done which messes up the parking and makes all the ocean veiw rooms on one side completely messed up. No balcony, and the window was do dirty that we could not see out it. There was grocery sacks stuffed around an open pipe in th bathroom and the beds were horrible. They even moved when you did. Of course booking thru an online source made it impossible to get our money back. We did ask if there was any other room, and they were more than happy to charge us 25 more dollars a night for an ocean front room which was the only one they had available. Well it was not much better. The bed was horrible. It was a murphy bed that really felt as if you were sleeping directly on plywood. The sides of the bed were broke and we scraped legs more than once. Also the bedspread was stained with something that looked like blood. This was a surprise anniversay trip planned by my husband and boy was it a surprise. If we had the money we would have left.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for $59.00”
Reviews.Author: LaRobley
Reviews.Content: Okay we decided to stay here even after the bad reviews. one we got there and seen the front we were worried about our decesion. The Elevators are terrible and the pool is okay and the beach side looks good after the remodel. We stayed in room 513 a oceanview room no balaconly yet still being constructed. The room had the old hotel smell but overall it wasn't a bad room pretty comfortable great view of the ocean & town. Excellent view of the saturday night fire works. the room could use better windows and the carpet replaced and rugs washed. But we still had a great time there and the price was pretty good. I will post pictures soon.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Dirty Dirty”
Reviews.Author: MyTravelTrips
Reviews.Content: For about $70 a night I wasn't really expecting a lot BUT this place was so dirty, gross, not even worth staying at for $70 a week. The balcony door would not lock leaving the room insecure so we had to take all valuables with us. The carpets were old and stained. Someone had squashed bugs on the walls and ceiling and they were still there when we checked in. We found an old dirty shirt with blood stains under one bed. The bathroom was dirty and gross. The pool was cloudy. Two small elevators that were so slow and also dirty. I don't think this place is ever cleaned at all. Avoid this place at any price.

Reviews.Title: “The Nasty Club Inn”
Reviews.Author: samanthaaa
Reviews.Content: OK, This place was a disaster! The worste hotel i have ever stayed in. First of all, they overcharged us on hotels.com because on the sign outside it said they had 45 dollar room, when we paid 85 a night. When we got there, they placed usin a smoking room, when we clearly said no smoking. Then we moved to a new room. It was so nasty, there were stains all over the walls, carpet, bed everything. I had to take like 5 showers a day just to feel the least bit clean. There was SO much noise because they were renivating the outside, THE OUTSIDE!!?!?!? what about the NASTY inside? I mean, it was really really nasty. No blankets on the bed, and it STUNK! Like pee and smoke. Anyway, the front dest people are rude and annoying, and it is just nasty. Do not stay there. UH! SO GROSS! I think I got like 14 diseases from that place..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: skip69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Club in Early Jan and our stay was just great! Rooms were clean, and the Staff very helpful in locating places to eat and visit Will stay there again in July and looking forward to it Thanks again for a nice experience

Reviews.Title: “Speedweek rip off!!”
Reviews.Author: Megcheer99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are Northeastern Nascar fans and decided to take a trip to the Daytona 500!!! This is my first Daytona 500 and it is also the week of valentines day :) We stayed from 02/13/07-02/19/07 and I was so dissapointed I cried the entire first night we were there. We had spent over 200.00 a night on this hotel and the pool was out of service, the hot tub was out of service and I was pratically allergic to my room. It was so miserable we tried to stay out of our room. I have never been so dissapointed. Then the second night we are there we see on the hotel billboard outside rooms available for 99.00 a night! I am only 26 years old and last I checked I had not won the lotto so a savings of 109.00 dollars a night would have almost made this place worth it. This is not the place for couples and my boyfriend and I wish we would have never stayed here. It wasn't the absolutely worst I have ever stayed in but is in my top 3 for the worst hotels I have ever stayed in and I have done my share of traveling. The hotel itself is extremely run down the hallways and doorhandles are disgustingly dirty. This hotel looks like a spring back factory not a 209.00 a night place to sleep. I don't know if it was the dust in our room or what but my boyfriend (who has never had allergies) and I were up half the night sneezing and miserable and wound up sleeping with the patio door open during the one time in FL when it was in the 30's!!!! If I were you I would not stay here but that is just my opinion! Meghan From CT

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GoneToMyHappyPlace
Reviews.Content: We stayed two different times and enjoyed it.m All of u who gave it a 1 2 or 3 must have champaigne taste. We went for the beach and sight seeing. We stayed in two diffrent rooms and for the price was great!!! And the rooms we were in were clean. But we clean up after ourselves too. The club was having trouble with people that was staying there. They were putting their trash and Pizza boxes in the hallways. That might be where the roaches were going though we didn't see any. We are planning a return visit this summer! : )

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Satisfied a diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Minnestoasnowbird
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Florida and am familar with the climate and the tourist season. I now live in Rochester, Minnesota were the average temperature this time of year is 32 degrees, need I say more.. I wanted to get away for an extended weekend for some low maintenance "RR". So I booked this hotel but was groaning after I read the travel advisory... expecting the worst. But I got what I expected and was Very Satisfied... for these reasons: This time of year the crowds are pleasantly non-existant I didn't travel with small children which always makes vacationing a bit high maintenance all be it enjoyable. The room # 618 was a bargain at 53.00 per night (3 nights) for 2 adults. It was clean but no frills. The room itself was an extended double bed kitchenette style room-perfect for 2 ladies on vacation. But certainly not suite size for small children. It was clean and orderly-No bugs or odors to be found. However the cleaning staff only changed towels daily. No bed change or vacuum.. but hey I don't do that everyday at home either. I would have been more obliged to tip the staff had those things been done. The location of the hotel "right on the beach" is the best. If you wanted something quick to eat for breakfast or lunch the hotel had "mimi's cafe" which served easy breakfast or lunch with specials at 3.00 per meal and nothing that exceeded 5.00 was a steal. The dishes were simple and yummy what I would expect at home. Things that will make your stay comfortable: Off season: lots of city construction and building maintenance going on. I always travel with ear plugs and an extra blanket. For this trip these were life savers. Our room cornered the busy street and beachview. There was no hotel hall noise but the street was pretty busy (earplugs work great for restful nights). For some reason the rooms had no blankets, I typically bring my own with me so that wasn't a problem either. Pool side was noisey because the hotel was redoing the balconies, strange seeing the ocean but not being able to hear it. Fix: rent the lawn chairs and umbrella rentals on the beach (already set up by rental company literally two steps from the pool) at 20.00 all day it's worth every penny. If your disappointed with the boring off season night life drive to St. Augustine (40 minute drive) and enjoy the drink and music of one of the oldest historical cities in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Three Stars? Whatever!”
Reviews.Author: PeggyinGA
Reviews.Content: OK when we booked this hotel the price was pretty low, so we were a bit skeptical at first, but when we realized it was a 3 star hotel we knew it wouldnt be a dump or anything. WE WERE WRONG. That's exactly what it was a dump! The floors were nasty the TV was like a 13" and the stand it was on was broken. The lamp in the room was like in 3 pieces but still provided light so im assuming that's why it wasn't replaced. (but it definetely needed to be). The bed was riduclulously hard, and my back is STILL hurting from it. As far as the staff was concerned... friendly isn't the word, rude is more like what I was thinking. I asked for some towels and the guy rudely asked how many and I said "four please" then he said said I'll give you only two". On top of that, it was the first hotel where i'd ever been and they didn't even provide anytime of shampoo or shower caps. Whatever good things you read about this place is a lie, and dont believe it. It's a ONE star hotel, at the most.

Reviews.Title: “view great, room dirty”
Reviews.Author: pkween
Reviews.Content: Our room was on 7th floor facing ocean. View from balcony was great. Room contained fridge, micro, range. Beds comfortable. BUT..Carpet stained, hallways dirty, couch and chaise stained, blinds broken. I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor on facilities”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTourist2006
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor for all the hotels that I stayed at in Florda, but a little disappointed with this one. When we checked in, we were sent to an excellent room, albeit on the side of the hotel, overlooking the construction of another tall hotel. But as it was for only 1 night, we knew that it wouldn't be a problem. After dropping off our bags, we went to explore the hotel & surrounding, & to find somewhere for dinner. At first, we saw a bar in the hotel lobby, so thought great for a beer later. Unfortunately, this was not the case as it wasn't opened. Little did I know it at the time of booking, but we were out of season, so the hotel didn't have the bar open. And in general the beach area was very quiet. We went out & found the only place within walking distance to eat at, Steve's Diner. It was great. The waiter took care of us 'English' & we left with full stomachs. If you are staying out of season, we were told to stay on the main land, rather than the beach as there would have been more to do. Overall, the hotel was average, but very reasonably priced for the 75 dollars we paid for the night. One tip - forget the complimentary breakfast, go eat elsewhere! We had a box with a muffin, orange & a few other items that a lot of people just threw into the bin!! The guy that was looking after it (catering firm not the hotel) could have learnt to smile a bit, make us feel welcome rather than disturbing his time.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars, are you kidding me?!?!”
Reviews.Author: Clovis29
Reviews.Content: Um, three stars?? This has to be a joke. We were so excited to get to our hotel on the beach. What a HUGE dissapointment. While the location is lovely and the lobby inviting, the rooms are foul and absoluty dreadful (and beleive me, I'm not that picky). The first room we went to had dirty beds (that's right, the sheets had not even been changed!). We asked to change rooms and the next one initially appeared fine. There was an amonia stench which I contributed to some type of cleaning product and figured it would soon dissapate so we moved our luggage to our new room. The smell was present the entire night (thankfully we only booked one night), there was a huge wet spot on the carpet by the air conditioner, two lamps didn't work and were so obviously broken I can't beleive they didn't bother to replace them, the beds were clean but the bedspread was filthy (and no blanket, not that I would have used it was there one), and it was just simply a dive. This hotel is a one star at best. Clearly they have received a high rating due to their location, but don't let it fool you. Knowing what I know now I wouldn't pay $10 to stay here. Try the La Quinta next door, it looked about a hundred times better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates at a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rqueenva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location July 4 - 8th. We were presently surprised at the accommodations. The resort was an easy 10 minute walk to the Ocean Walk area and surrounding restaurants and stores. The room was large with two double beds and a kitchenette that included a large refrigerator, a smaller refridgerator, a small stove with oven and a microwave. The unit we were in and an abundant amount of drawer space. Te room was cleaned daily and well maintained. The front desk personnel were friendly and accommodating. The hotel is right on the beach and has a small pool area. I couldn't believe we found this gem for only $70.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Nice !!!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTraveler37
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! We've stayed there before, and last time we were not impressed with the place, but liked the price, location, pool, and beach. This time, we stayed there again, and had a magnificent room .... newly furnished and decorated with bright tropical colors, super clean, all new everything, and exceptionally nice!! We were lucky that we got Rm 525 which was outstanding. I understand that these are condos, so each room is owned, decorated and cared for differently. Our friends had a not-so-nice room upstairs for a higher price and they were really unhappy about their accommodations, but we loved our room. Great place to stay! Friendly and courteous staff as well!

Reviews.Title: “What A Change”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: VERY NICE. I had stayed here once before and had a few problems, which when I brought them to the hotel management's attention they were remedied. It seemed dingy, and I didn't feel real good about the place. But this year, I had to make a late reservation for the races, and there were not alot of choices left, and I knew it wasn't a disaster area. WHAT A DIFFERENCE. My room was clean and pleasantly decorated, not like a prison cell. The TV, phone and bathroom were in good working order. The kitchen had everything you would need for cooking, and eating. I was pleasantly surprised. One of the employees told me they had been slowly working on getting things back into shape, and I could tell the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room, convenient ocean front access”
Reviews.Author: asitbon
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant after reading the reviews but we were PLEASANTLY surprised. Our room, unit #208, was a small studio but it was SPOTLESS. There was a comfortable Murphy bed and a sofa bed, enough to fit 4 comfortably. Obviously the owner of the unit cared about the condition of their condo and most things were new or newer. The only thing that bothered me was that the screen was missing from the window, but it didn't matter because the door led to a small balcony with a FABULOUS view of the Atlantic Ocean and pool. This condo complex, considering its age, is well-kept, the staff is friendly and you can't beat its location...right in the heart of all the action on Daytona Beach!!

Reviews.Title: “this place ia a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i totally agree with the other 6 reviews of this hotel. I thought this place was a dump, and from reading the other reviews, my experience may have been a little better than theirs!! stayed 3 nites,wouldnt have stayed that many but the 5 yr old girl was wanting to get a room sooo bad, and we just toughed it out the 3 days. we paid 89.00 a nite for 3 nites. the beds were uncomfortable, staying there made me feel like i was dirty. and for sure, dont try to get extra towels or washcloths. so, do yourself a favor and DONT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. nuts and bolts nuts and bolts. we got screwed : (

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Four people in my family booked this hotel over a travel agency. We prayed it was good because of the cheap prices. We got to our room and it smelled horrible. There were cigarette butts all over the porch, the doors were hard to open and there was mold in the bathroom. We complained to the manager and got a different room on the 6th floor. It was only a little better because there was no smell. The sheets had red stains on them, we didnt ask what they were, and the carpets were horrible and stained. The desk clerks were incredibly rude and they didnt give out extra towels or blankets of any kind. In the slow cramped elevators guests told us to take all expensive valuable items to the car because the cleaning service had a tendency to steal things. The only good part was it being on the beach, and having a decent pool. Luckily we only stayed there 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: JenNiffer
Reviews.Content: We had a week long reservation and were checked out after our first night. Hard, small beds, old hotel. Saw cockroaches in the stairwell... same stairwell where we saw the maid DRAGGING a bed comforter down the stairs. My husband overheard another guest demanding her money back at the front desk because there were 5 cockroaches in her room, two of them IN HER BED. The cheap rate is not worth staying at this hotel. It's true that you really get what you pay for. P.S. For the rest of our stay, we stayed in Seashells Beach Club just a couple blocks north, right on the beach. I HIGHLY recommend Seashells Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and two children) and I were assigned to this hotel because we were going to do a "timeshare" thing where you go and see the timeshare (not there) while you are staying in Daytona. We pd a total of $168.00 for 3 nights Memorial Day weekend which is a great deal. We arrived at the hotel and went up to check out the room. We then turned around and walked out. The room was concrete block, the beds weren't made properly, the door to the balcony was flimsy and the paint was peeling and there were questionable characters hanging around the hotel. My kids (6 and 8) wanted to check out the game room. Only 1 of the 3 games was working. We left and went back to the Welcome Center of the timeshare people and told them we would find out own hotel. We lost the $89.00 we had originally paid but it was worth it not to have to stay at this hotel. We did get back the $79.00 we had paid for an addtl 3rd night. This hotel was just old and run down and looked seedy. The front desk personnel were apathetic.

Reviews.Title: “lost my orbitz reservation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My plane was late, so I arrived with my 3 kids at midnight, they didn't have my reservation booked thru orbitz and although I had a printed out itinerary, they had no rooms. So they sent us to the travellodge. Then next day we got our room, thanks for squeezing us in, were put on the 5th floor , please note some people live here yer round, the room had cockroaches and bathroom was so covered in mold initially I thought it was just ugly wallpaper, til I scratched it with my nail. So again we moved , better room, still alot of roaches. I wrote the company and they said if I stayed with them again they'd make sure my stay was better. I ended up paying a hundred dollars more than I originally thought, for the other hotel, and had to switch 3 hotel rooms in 4 days with 3 kids, it sucked. Night staff was rude and turned me away when I had a reservation and management acted like it was my fault. Also on the street side, the creepy guy chain smoking on his porch in his panties was kind of disturbing. Thanks for ruining my 1st family vaction. Also, don't try to get extra pillows ,blankets, or towels, there are none available. Actually the travel lodge, which I wouldn't have booked at was way better and cleaner than this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and great prices...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. It is right in the middle of the action. You are close to the clubs and restaurants and the Boardwalk. The rooms are not fancy but they are clean and updated. The price was excellent when we compared it to other places.

HotelInfo.Name: Daytona Beach Club Oceanfront Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 800 North Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
